channel.title: üè¢ Renmin University of China on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Renmin University of China on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Bridging The Gap between Low-rank and Orthogonal Adaptation via Householder Reflection Adaptation
item.description: Householder Reflection Adaptation (HRA) bridges low-rank and orthogonal LLM adaptation, achieving superior performance with fewer parameters than existing methods. By using a chain of Householder refl…

item.title: CausalStock: Deep End-to-end Causal Discovery for News-driven Multi-stock Movement Prediction
item.description: CausalStock: A novel framework for accurate news-driven multi-stock movement prediction, using lag-dependent causal discovery and LLMs for enhanced noise reduction and explainability.

item.title: Conjugate Bayesian Two-step Change Point Detection for Hawkes Process
item.description: A novel conjugate Bayesian two-step change point detection method for Hawkes processes, CoBay-CPD, achieves higher accuracy and efficiency by employing data augmentation for improved dynamic event mod…

item.title: Enhancing In-Context Learning Performance with just SVD-Based Weight Pruning: A Theoretical Perspective
item.description: SVD-based weight pruning surprisingly boosts in-context learning in large language models, especially when applied to deeper layers, offering a novel approach to model compression and efficiency.

item.title: Intruding with Words: Towards Understanding Graph Injection Attacks at the Text Level
item.description: Researchers unveil text-level graph injection attacks, revealing a new vulnerability in GNNs and highlighting the importance of text interpretability in attack success.

item.title: S-MolSearch: 3D Semi-supervised Contrastive Learning for Bioactive Molecule Search
item.description: S-MolSearch: a novel semi-supervised framework using 3D molecular data and contrastive learning achieves state-of-the-art in bioactive molecule search, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Towards Understanding How Transformers Learn In-context Through a Representation Learning Lens
item.description: Transformers’ in-context learning (ICL) is explained using representation learning, revealing its ICL process as gradient descent on a dual model and offering modifiable attention layers for enhanced …

item.title: Towards Understanding the Working Mechanism of Text-to-Image Diffusion Model
item.description: Stable Diffusion’s text-to-image generation is sped up by 25% by removing text guidance after the initial shape generation, revealing that the [EOS] token is key to early-stage image construction.
